title: Can I amend my discharge 2017 ?
question: I had a creditor from 2014 that was not on my credit report but I did report the debt to my bankruptcy attorney. I notified the creditor that I need to surrender- due to filing bankruptcy no response. 2 years later the someone took over the business and it's on my credit as collection dated 2019 do I have to dispute or amend or what advise can you give me?
answers: You should speak to your lawyer that represented you. There may be specific things you need to do to dispute a discharged debt. Your lawyer should know the proper procedure and if not, you should contact a lawyer that specializes in discharge order violations or credit reporting violations. However, the first thing you should do is to is talk to your bankruptcy attorney and go from there.

Depending upon the local practice, and whether or not your case was "no asset" it may be necessary to reopen and add the creditor, or not. Depends on what the courts in the 9th Circuit have held. Ask your attorney.
Since you were represented by counsel, you need to direct your questions to your attorney.
